p: Palm oil is one of the worldâ€™s most widely consumed oils. Palm oil contains equal portions of saturated and unsaturated fatty acids [ 15]. It is excellent for deep-fat frying on a continuous basis as it has a balanced saturated-unsaturated fatty acid composition and good oxidative stability. Palm oil also has a significant level of natural antioxidants and has little tendency to form gums and off-flavors [ 16, 17]. Palm olein was also reported to be a stable frying oil [ 18, 19]. Palm olein not only has a higher stability index, [ 19, 20, 21, 22] but it also extends the shelf life of fried foods [ 19, 21, 22, 23, 24].
